items.sentence: If I had bought the painting then, I would be rich now.
If I were in your situation, I would do the same thing.
You don\'t have to stop reading just because I\'m here.
You don\'t have to talk about it if you don\'t want to.
Did the newspaper article say how fast Tom was driving?
Did you actually see Tom do what the police say he did?
Did you know there are three other Toms at this school?
Did you receive a Christmas present from Tom this year?
How dangerous do you think this mission is going to be?
Tom was the only one without enough money for the trip.
Tom was worried about what might happen if he did that.
Tom was writing at his desk when Mary entered the room.
I don\'t care why Tom did it. I\'m just glad he did it.
I\'d be grateful if you could help me move these boxes.
I\'ll do whatever I can to prevent that from happening.
I\'ll do whatever it takes to keep our family together.
I just want to let you know that I won\'t let you down.
Don\'t breathe a word of what I\'ve told you to anyone.
Don\'t throw out this magazine. I haven\'t read it yet.
Tom can\'t hold down a job. He\'s always getting fired.
Tom can\'t put up with Mary\'s carelessness any longer.
Getting down this mountain will take about three hours.
Have you already decided whether you want to go or not?
Have you ever eaten anything that made you hallucinate?
How many years have you been teaching children to swim?
I called Tom to apologize to him, but he hung up on me.
We\'ve got to find Tom before he does something stupid.
We\'ve had all kinds of weather over the past few days.
Well, I\'m afraid I must be leaving. I had a nice time.
I didn\'t expect that Tom would fall in love with Mary.
I plan to buy my mother some flowers for Mother\'s Day.
Tom lives with Mary in a small apartment near my house.
Tom looked both ways before he crossed the busy street.
Tom looked into the room and saw that nobody was there.
Tom lost both his parents when he was still very young.
Tom lost control of his car and crashed it into a tree.
Tom expects me to help Mary clean out the clogged pipe.
Tom got the job on the strength of your recommendation.
Tom had never realized just how lovely Mary really was.
Tom had never realized just how pretty Mary really was.
I don\'t know what it is, but it\'s something very big.
I don\'t know when I\'ll be able to get back to Boston.
I don\'t know whether he\'s younger or older than I am.
Tom tried to turn the doorknob, but it wouldn\'t budge.
It\'s convenient to live so close to the train station.
Let\'s finish this today, so that we can rest tomorrow.
Many people have told me that they think I\'m handsome.
I never see this picture without thinking of my father.
I suppose you want to ask me who I was with last night.
I thought for a moment Tom was going to start laughing.
